intro: Ruschia promontorii, commonly known as the promontory Ruschia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Ruschia promontorii is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
